definition: the Tang dynasty (618-907)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to exaggerate/empty/in vain/old variant of 螗[tang2]
Tang dynasty (618-907)/surname Tang
Three Murder Cases Solved by Judge Dee, 1949 novel by R.H. van Gulik, featuring Tang Dynasty politician Di Renjie 狄仁傑|狄仁杰[Di2 Ren2 jie2] as master sleuth
Tang Paradise in Xi'an
Great Tang Records on the Western Regions, travel record of Xuan Zang 玄奘[Xuan2 zang4], compiled by 辯機|辩机[Bian4 ji1] in 646

sentences.english: Datang Furong Garden is the main water-screen movie night, the well-known.
sentences.chinese: 大唐芙蓉园主要是晚上的水幕电影出名。

sentences.english: There are many small countries bow their head to Da T'ang at that time.
sentences.chinese: 当时大唐周边许多小国甘愿俯首称臣。

sentences.english: Analyzed the datang group again problems of strategic management.
sentences.chinese: 再次分析了大唐集团投资战略管理存在的问题。

sentences.english: It should be noted that all the articles published in this issue are contributed by the DTTTIG, to which we owe our acknowledgement.
sentences.chinese: 本期所刊论文均由大唐集团提供，在此特表谢意。

sentences.english: How about Luping or other restaurant in Datang?
sentences.chinese: 鲁平或其他餐厅大唐如何？

sentences.english: Audience friends, in the Datang Furongyuan Park, there is also a Tang-style market.
sentences.chinese: 观众朋友们，这大唐芙蓉园里还有一个唐代集市。

sentences.english: Datang Telecom's reorganization has been in confusion all along.
sentences.chinese: 大唐电信重组一直以来给外界以迷雾般的印象。

sentences.english: Waterscreen Film in Xi'an Tang Paradise is a great show.
sentences.chinese: 西安大唐芙蓉园的水幕电影是非常好的表演。
日本文献中就记载有“大唐粽子”。

definition: Tang dynasty (618-907)
Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
Nanzhao kingdom 738-937 in southwest China and southeast Asia
Han Dynasty term for the Roman Empire 羅馬帝國|罗马帝国[Luo2 ma3 Di4 guo2]
Western Regions (Han Dynasty term for regions beyond Yumen Pass 玉門關|玉门关[Yu4 men2 Guan1])
Turkic ethnic group
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
Western Xia dynasty 1038-1227 of Tangut people 黨項|党项 occupying modern Ningxia and parts of Gansu and Shaanxi, overthrown by Mongols
Anxi county, former name of Guazhou county 瓜州縣|瓜州县[Gua1 zhou1 xian4] in Jiuquan 酒泉[Jiu3 quan2], Gansu
Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
Goguryeo (37 BC-668 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
An-Shi Rebellion (755-763) of 安祿山|安禄山[An1 Lu4 shan1] and 史思明[Shi3 Si1 ming2], a catastrophic setback for Tang dynasty
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Southern Dynasties (420-589)
Korean Goryeo dynasty, 918-1392/Korea, esp. in context of art and culture
